name: Technological Typography
summary: What does it mean to design with code? In this lesson, we’ll discover how HTML and CSS work together to structure and style content for the web.
outcomes: How to code HTML with inline CSS, HTML tags for typographic elements, CSS properties for styling typography
concepts: HTML tags, inline CSS, CSS properties

name: A Class on Classes
summary: How can I tell what anything is when you look at code? In this lesson, we’ll look at how we organize code with HTML tags and CSS classes.
outcomes: How to reuse styles with CSS classes, How to set up a typographic hierarchy
html: h1–h6, a, strong, em, ul, ol, li

name: Coding on Your Own (Device)
summary: How can I take my code off this website? In this lesson, we’ll introduce text editors and learn how to make and access HTML and CSS files.
outcomes: How to use text editor and save code as documents, How to format an HTML document

name: So, What Is a Website?
summary: What are websites, really? In this lesson, we’ll talk about the field of computer science and how websites came to be.

name: Do Designers Code?
summary: What careers are available to web designers? In this lesson, we’ll talk about the differences between design and development and the crossover opportunities for designer-developers.

name: Going Live
summary: How can I turn my code into a website someone else can access? In this lesson, we’ll use Github to publish your code and make it accessible via the internet.
outcomes: How to manage a GitHub repository, How to organize your code to launch a website

name: The Click of a Mouse
summary: How can I make my website more interactive? In this lesson, we’ll introduce basic interactivity through hover and active states.

name: Making Your Code Dance
summary: How can I make my website more dynamic? In this lesson, we’ll use keyframed animations to make elements change on their own.

name: Working with Variable Fonts
summary: How can I use variable fonts on my website? In this lesson, we’ll explore the benefits and applications for variable fonts on the web.

name: No Screen Too Small
summary: How can I make my website work on phones? In this lesson, we’ll use media queries to create a responsive website.

name: Who Uses the Web?
summary: How can I make my website more accessible for all users? In this lesson, we’ll consider web accessibility guidelines and best practices for commercial websites.

name: Grid Systems in (Web) Design
summary: How can I create a simple, organized web layout? In this lesson, we’ll use CSS grid to create a dynamic grid system.

name: Flexible Rows and Columns
summary: How can I arrange content in a single row or column? In this lesson, we’ll use flexbox to create responsive one-dimensional layouts.

name: I’m Only Learning to Code to Create My Portfolio
summary: How can I create a portfolio? In this lesson, we’ll bring together all the concepts we’ve learned so far to create a basic responsive portfolio website.

name: Inspecting the Web
summary: How can I analyze a website someone else created? In this lesson, we’ll use developer tools within your browser for inspecting code on live websites.

name: No-code Web Development
summary: How can I make use of these lessons if I don’t want to code? In this lesson, we’ll introduce Webflow and use its visual editor to design sites without HTML and CSS.

name: If This, Then That
summary: How can I make my website even more dynamic and interactive? In this lesson, we’ll introduce JavaScript and discover how it works with HTML and CSS.
javascript: onclick, innerHTML, innerText, style, classList, querySelector(), function

name: One Fewer Click
summary: How can I modify user interaction over time? In this lesson, we’ll use event listeners to dynamically add and remove functions from your site.

name: Make it Drag
summary: How can I make something draggable? In this lesson, we’ll combine a few event listeners with some math to create user-draggable elements.

name: On an (Set) Interval
summary: How can I automatically trigger a JavaScript function multiple times? In this lesson, we’ll use JavaScript’s setInterval function to run code more than once.

name: End the Loop
summary: How can I trigger a function only a few times? In this lesson, we’ll explore loops and learn how to use basic math to your advantage.

name: A Set of Stuff
summary: How can we keep track of data in our code? In this lesson, we’ll use arrays and objects for storing and modifying variables.

name: Coding with Code
summary: How can I write code that writes code for me? In this lesson, we’ll create a JSON file and use it to generatively populate a website.

name: A World of Code
summary: How do I know what functions are available to me? In this lesson, we’ll learn about JavaScript libraries and how to keep learning beyond this course.

name: Form and Code
summary: How can I use websites to create art? In this lesson, we’ll look at p5.js as an entryway into creative coding.

name: Musical Machines
summary: How can I use websites to create music? In this lesson, we’ll look at Tone.js as a tool for working with sound through code.
